section.title: Preparing NFS Storage
section.para: These steps must be taken to prepare an NFS file share on a server running Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 for use with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization.

step.title: Install nfs-utils
step.para: NFS functionality is provided by the nfs-utils package. Before file shares can be created, check that the package is installed by querying the RPM database for the system:

If the nfs-utils package is installed then the package information will be displayed. If no output is displayed then the package is not currently installed. Install it using yum while logged in as the root user:

step.title: Configure Boot Scripts
step.para: To ensure thatNFS shares are always available when the system is operational both the nfs and rpcbind services must start at boot time. Use the chkconfig command while logged in as root to modify the boot scripts.
step.screen: # chkconfig --add rpcbind # chkconfig --add nfs # chkconfig rpcbind on # chkconfig nfs on
step.para: Once the boot script configuration has been done, start the services for the first time.
step.screen: # service rpcbind start # service nfs start

step.title: Create Directory
step.para: Create the directory you wish to share using NFS.
Replace /exports/iso with the name, and path of the directory you wish to use.

step.title: Export Directory
step.para: To be accessible over the network using NFS the directory must be exported. NFS exports are controlled using the /etc/exports configuration file. Each export path appears on a separate line followed by a tab character and any additional NFS options.
